comments:
build 2002-03-14 on Win98.

- was programming for about 5 hours (without restarting Eclipse)
- got a No More Handles exception and was prompted to close the workspace
- closed and saved OK

- Note: no other applications running at the time (not Notes, not IE although 
they had been previously started and stopped a couple of times)
- Note: I used to get this error a lot (especially when running Eclipse in 
Eclipse) but I haven't seen it in months
- Note: I hadn't been running Eclipse in Eclipse, just running our test suites
- Note: development is done entirely in (my own) Java perspective and Debug 
perspectives

Here is the log file with the error.

Log: Sat Mar 16 13:39:46 EST 2002
1 org.eclipse.core.resources 4 Unhandled exception caught in event loop.
Log: Sat Mar 16 13:39:46 EST 2002
4 org.eclipse.ui 0 No more handles
org.eclipse.swt.SWTError: No more handles
	at org.eclipse.swt.SWT.error(SWT.java:1912)
	at org.eclipse.swt.graphics.Image.init(Image.java(Compiled Code))
	at org.eclipse.swt.graphics.Image.init(Image.java(Compiled Code))
	at org.eclipse.swt.custom.StyledText.handlePaint(StyledText.java
(Compiled Code))
	at org.eclipse.swt.custom.StyledText.handlePaint(StyledText.java
(Compiled Code))
	at org.eclipse.swt.custom.StyledText$13.handleEvent(StyledText.java
(Compiled Code))
	at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Widget.sendEvent(Widget.java(Compiled Code))
	at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Widget.sendEvent(Widget.java(Compiled Code))
	at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Composite.WM_PAINT(Composite.java(Compiled 
Code))
	at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Control.windowProc(Control.java(Compiled 
Code))
	at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Display.windowProc(Display.java(Compiled 
Code))
	at org.eclipse.swt.internal.win32.OS.DispatchMessageA(Native Method)
	at org.eclipse.swt.internal.win32.OS.DispatchMessage(OS.java(Compiled 
Code))
	at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Display.readAndDispatch(Display.java
(Compiled Code))
	at org.eclipse.ui.internal.Workbench.runEventLoop(Workbench.java
(Compiled Code))
	at org.eclipse.ui.internal.Workbench.run(Workbench.java:675)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.boot.InternalBootLoader.run
(InternalBootLoader.java:777)
	at org.eclipse.core.boot.BootLoader.run(BootLoader.java:319)
	at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Native Method)
	at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.basicRun(Main.java:151)
	at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.run(Main.java:502)
	at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.main(Main.java:362)

Also note that my machine hadn't been rebooted for probably 2 or 3 days. (not 
sure if that makes a difference or not)

Note this is Win98. CM to investigate if this is related to accessibility 
changes.

Note that this happened again this morning.
Same scenerio. (no other apps open, hadn't rebooted for a day or so)

I will look, but at first glance I think it is much more likely to be changes 
in StyledText - I do not currntly have any accessibility added to StyledText, 
and from the stack trace, that's where the error occurred.

It's doubtful that this is StyledText, but we will double check to make sure we 
aren't leaking resources.  Most likely scenario is someone else in Eclipse 
leaking resources and StyledText just happens to be the one that needs a 
resource when no more are left.
Verified that StyledText is disposing of the resources it creates.

Was not related to accessibility changes. I ran for quite a while, and did not 
have any casses where the number of AddRef's exceeded the number of Releases.
OLE objects do take up some space, but Veronika says it's not too bad.
They don't take up any handles.
Have you seen this problem since then?
I have since changed my OS to WinXP. (and therefore haven't seen this problem)
*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 16101 ***
